overview.system_description: The UK offers various visa routes: Visitor, Student, Work, Family / Settlement, Post-Study (Graduate), ILR, etc.
overview.key_changes: Major revision to visa fees came into effect on 9 April 2025
overview.premium_services: Priority and Super Priority services remain in use

visitor_short_term.validity: Multiple entry possible, depending on visa type

student.immigration_health_surcharge: Depends on visa length; charged per year (~£1,035/year for worker)
student.dependents: Possible on many student visas (spouse, children)
student.validity: Duration of course + extension allowed for certain post-study routes

skilled_worker.requirements: Job offer from a licensed UK sponsor

graduate_post_study.purpose: Allows graduates from UK institutions to stay and work / look for work after their course
graduate_post_study.fee: Follows 'Work Visa' rules depending on route / duration
graduate_post_study.rights: Work full-time, no requirement for specific sponsor (depending on route)

family_settlement.additional: Biometric Residence Permit (BRP) may be required

other_special.note: Refer to UKVI for specific 2025 rates and rules

processing_services.processing_times: Varies by visa route: use UKVI / VFS for current estimates
processing_services.digital_evisa: Many visa decisions / status handled via online portals

common_denial_reasons: Weak proof of relationship (for family visas)
Failing to meet English language requirement
tips: Use the latest fee table (post April 2025) when calculating costs
Maintain strong documentation (job offer, financial proof, sponsor letters)
Consider priority services if you need faster decisions
Track biometric appointment & keep documentation ready
